page.title: 10Buses in Melchbourne
page.content: The United Counties buses do not go to Melchbourne; to catch a public bus residents have to walk about 1.5 miles to Dean Entrance. This is an infrequent service to Bedford and St Neots. There is a coach which takes people to Rushden on Wednesdays and Fridays. This only costs 10p for pensioners if they have a pensioners bus pass as it is subsidised by the County Council. The fare for every one else is 60p. The children in the village that go to school in Risely and Sharnbrook have a special coach. This can only be used by school children. Most people in Melchbourne have a car and the households where the husband works out of the village have two cars.
